entry_level.description: This roadmap is shared across all entry-level Security Engineer timelines (ASAP, 6 Months, 1 Year, Flexible). The only difference is in the suggested duration per module, adjusted below per timeline. It is designed for beginners seeking a foundation in enterprise security architecture, vulnerability management, secure system design, and cloud security principles.

security_fundamentals_and_risk_managemen.description: Core principles of information security and foundational risk management techniques.

checklist.task: Study CIA Triad and fundamental security principles
Learn NIST Cybersecurity Framework components
Complete risk assessment and management fundamentals
Study security governance and policy development
Learn threat modeling basics (STRIDE, PASTA)
Complete business continuity and disaster recovery planning

network_security_and_infrastructure.description: Understanding secure networking concepts, firewalls, IDS/IPS, and infrastructure security.

checklist.task: Master TCP/IP networking and OSI model
Learn firewall configuration and management
Study VPN technologies (IPSec, SSL/TLS)
Practice IDS/IPS deployment and tuning
Learn network segmentation and VLAN security
Study wireless security protocols and implementation

identity_and_access_management.description: Learn access control protocols, directory services, and identity federation systems.

checklist.task: Learn Active Directory fundamentals and security
Study LDAP, SAML, and OAuth protocols
Practice Single Sign‑On implementation
Learn Multi‑Factor Authentication deployment
Study RBAC principles
Practice privileged access management concepts

endpoint_security_and_system_hardening.description: Develop proficiency in securing endpoints and hardening systems against attacks.

checklist.task: Learn Windows and Linux system hardening
Study endpoint detection and response solutions
Practice antivirus and anti‑malware deployment
Learn patch management and vulnerability assessment
Study data loss prevention implementation
Practice mobile device management configuration

compliance_and_regulatory_frameworks.description: Understand major compliance requirements and regulatory frameworks.

checklist.task: Study PCI DSS requirements and implementation
Learn HIPAA security and privacy requirements
Study SOX IT controls and compliance
Learn GDPR data protection requirements
Study ISO 27001 information security management
Practice compliance auditing and documentation

security_tools_and_technologies.description: Hands‑on learning with key security tools and platforms used across the industry.

checklist.task: Learn SIEM deployment and basic log analysis
Practice vulnerability scanning with Nessus/OpenVAS
Study web application security testing tools
Learn security orchestration and automation basics
Practice with penetration testing tools (Nmap, Burp Suite)
Study threat intelligence platforms and feeds

timeline_options.name: ASAP (Intensive)
timeline_options.description: Accelerated path ideal for full-time learners seeking to transition into entry-level security roles as quickly as possible.

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced timeline suitable for individuals managing part-time work or academic commitments while studying.

timeline_options.name: 1 Year
timeline_options.description: Low-intensity schedule perfect for professionals or students with limited weekly availability.

timeline_options.name: Flexible
timeline_options.description: Adaptable path for learners who prefer to design their own schedule and pace based on personal availability and learning

hands_on_labs.description: Use Oracle VirtualBox to build multi-OS testing environments for security experiments.

hands_on_labs.name: pfSense Lab – Firewall Configuration
hands_on_labs.description: Hands-on firewall and network security setup using pfSense virtual appliances.

hands_on_labs.name: Active Directory Lab – Identity Management
hands_on_labs.description: Practice building and securing Active Directory environments with Microsoft tools.

hands_on_labs.name: Vulnerability Scanning Lab – Nessus/OpenVAS
hands_on_labs.description: Deploy and configure Nessus or OpenVAS to perform vulnerability discovery and reporting.

mid_level.description: This roadmap builds upon the entry-level foundation and targets security engineers with 1–2 years of experience. The goal is to transition from basic security implementation to advanced architecture design, automation, and specialized security domains.

cloud_security_architecture.description: Design and implement secure cloud environments across AWS, Azure, and GCP with IaC and container protection.

checklist.task: Master AWS security services (IAM, GuardDuty, CloudTrail, Config)
Learn Azure security controls (Security Center, Sentinel, Key Vault)
Study GCP security (Cloud Security Command Center, IAM)
Implement IaC security (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Learn container security (Docker, Kubernetes)
Practice cloud compliance and governance frameworks

devsecops_and_secure_development.description: Embed security into development pipelines using SAST, DAST, SCA, IaC scanning, and secrets management.

checklist.task: Implement security in CI/CD pipelines
Learn SAST integration
Practice DAST automation
Study SCA for dependencies
Implement IaC scanning
Learn secrets management in workflows

security_automation_and_orchestration.description: Automate security configurations and incident response workflows using Python, Ansible, SOAR, and APIs.

checklist.task: Master Python scripting for security automation
Learn Ansible for security configuration management
Implement Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR)
Practice API integration for security tools
Build automated incident response workflows
Learn Infrastructure as Code for security deployments

advanced_threat_detection_and_analysis.description: Develop expertise in SIEM, detection engineering, threat hunting, and behavioral analytics using industry tools.

checklist.task: Design and implement advanced SIEM use cases
Learn behavioral analytics and anomaly detection
Create custom detection rules using Sigma format
Implement threat hunting programs and methodologies
Study machine learning applications in security
Practice threat intelligence integration and analysis

zero_trust_architecture_and_identity_sec.description: Implement Zero Trust principles with identity-centric controls, PAM, and continuous verification.

checklist.task: Study NIST Zero Trust Architecture principles
Implement identity-centric security controls
Deploy Privileged Access Management (PAM) solutions
Practice Conditional Access and risk-based authentication
Learn Just-In-Time (JIT) access and Privileged Identity Management
Implement continuous trust verification mechanisms

data_security_and_privacy_engineering.description: Protect sensitive data through encryption, DLP, anonymization, and regulatory compliance.

checklist.task: Implement data classification and labeling systems
Learn encryption key management and rotation
Study data loss prevention (DLP) advanced deployment
Implement privacy-by-design principles
Practice data anonymization and pseudonymization techniques
Learn database security and transparent data encryption

timeline_options.description: Fast-track intensive learning path designed for professionals seeking immediate transition into mid-level security engineering roles.

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced timeline for those managing a job or other commitments while steadily progressing through core modules.

hands_on_labs.name: AWS Free Tier – Cloud Security Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Hands-on experience with IAM, GuardDuty, CloudTrail, and security groups using AWS’s free tier services.

hands_on_labs.name: Microsoft Azure Security Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Practice with Azure Security Center, Sentinel, Key Vault, and role-based access using the Azure free account.

hands_on_labs.name: Google Cloud Security Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Explore IAM, Cloud Security Command Center, and network security controls using GCP’s free tier.

hands_on_labs.name: Docker & Kubernetes Security Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Simulate container hardening, secure deployments, and network policies using local Docker and Kubernetes environments.

hands_on_labs.name: GitLab CI/CD Security Pipeline Lab
hands_on_labs.description: Implement SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, and secrets detection in DevSecOps workflows with GitLab’s free tier.

hands_on_labs.name: Elastic Stack SIEM Lab
hands_on_labs.description: Build detection rules and analyze security logs using Elastic Security features on Elastic Stack.

senior_level.description: This roadmap builds on mid-level experience and prepares professionals to lead security architecture design, enterprise security strategy, and organizational security transformation initiatives.

enterprise_security_architecture_strateg.description: Design, plan, and govern enterprise-wide security architectures using frameworks like SABSA, TOGAF, and NIST.

checklist.task: Master enterprise architecture frameworks (SABSA, TOGAF)
Design security reference architectures
Study security governance and risk management frameworks
Learn strategic security planning and roadmap development
Practice business case development for security investments
Master security architecture review and approval processes

advanced_cloud_security_and_multi_cloud_.description: Scale secure cloud architectures across multiple platforms, with CSPM, container security, serverless, and hybrid integration.

checklist.task: Design multi-cloud security architectures
Implement Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)
Master container orchestration security (Kubernetes, OpenShift)
Study serverless security and FaaS protection
Implement cloud-native security tools and services
Practice hybrid cloud security and integration strategies

security_leadership_and_team_management.description: Develop leadership and management skills necessary to lead security teams and initiatives across the enterprise.

checklist.task: Study leadership and team management principles
Learn project and program management for security initiatives
Practice stakeholder management and executive communication
Master budget planning and resource allocation
Learn vendor management and procurement processes
Study organizational change management for security transformation

advanced_threat_intelligence_and_securit.description: Design and operate enterprise-level threat intelligence and SOC capabilities, with APT detection and active defense.

checklist.task: Design threat intelligence programs and processes
Implement APT detection strategies
Study cyber threat landscape and nation‑state activities
Design SOC architecture and processes
Practice threat modeling for complex enterprise environments
Learn cyber deception and active defense techniques

regulatory_compliance_and_legal_framewor.description: Ensure enterprise security readiness through legal and regulatory compliance, privacy, audit, and reporting frameworks.

checklist.task: Master global privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA, LGPD)
Study industry‑specific compliance requirements (HIPAA, PCI DSS, SOX)
Learn data governance and privacy program management
Practice compliance gap analysis and remediation planning
Study legal aspects of cybersecurity and incident response
Learn audit management and regulatory reporting

emerging_technologies_and_innovation.description: Stay ahead in cybersecurity by exploring AI/ML security, quantum-safe cryptography, IoT/OT, blockchain, 5G, and emerging research.

checklist.task: Study AI/ML security
Learn quantum implications for cryptography
Practice IoT and OT security architecture design
Study blockchain and distributed ledger security
Learn 5G network security considerations
Practice emerging threat research and analysis

timeline_options.name: ASAP (Intensive)
timeline_options.description: Accelerated, full-time commitment for those aiming to transition quickly into senior cybersecurity roles or architecture positions.

timeline_options.name: 6 Months
timeline_options.description: Balanced timeline ideal for professionals looking to build advanced skills while managing part-time work or study.

timeline_options.name: 1 Year
timeline_options.description: Ideal for full-time professionals who prefer a steady pace to deeply understand enterprise security architecture and leadership concepts.

timeline_options.name: Flexible
timeline_options.description: Customized pace for learners with unpredictable schedules. Best for long-term career planners and continuous learners.

hands_on_labs.description: Use Azure Sandbox environments to prototype complex enterprise security architectures with bastions, firewalls, AD, VNets.

hands_on_labs.description: Hands-on cloud security challenges across AWS, GCP, and Azure, focusing on misconfigurations and attack/defense scenarios.

hands_on_labs.name: Awesome‑CloudSec‑Labs
hands_on_labs.description: A curated GitHub collection of self-hosted cloud labs (CloudGoat, GCPGoat, PurpleCloud) for AWS, Azure and GCP experiments.

hands_on_labs.name: Multi‑Cloud Red Team Analyst (MCRTA)
hands_on_labs.description: Professional-level multi-cloud red team training and labs across AWS, Azure, and GCP.

hands_on_labs.name: Thunder CTF – Cloud Security Challenge
hands_on_labs.description: Deployable CTF framework for practicing cloud security scenarios on a budget.

hands_on_labs.name: Red Hat Interactive Labs
hands_on_labs.description: Practice secure containerization, automation, and Linux security using browser-based Red Hat labs.
